intro: Nototrichium divaricatum, commonly known as the variable bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and prairies, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Nototrichium divaricatum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
